text: I I I pick the standard economic
definition of
rationality uh because once you start
incorporating all kinds of things into
rationality it just becomes a
meaningless concept so if you say um
people are rational but yes but I also
care about your welfare and let's add
that as another component of utility
into the equation that every time you
you're making up another part of utility
it means that you kind of undermine the
concept of rationality and you know I
I'm a behavior Economist which means
that most of my work is showing that
people are irrational but I love
economics economics is is beautiful it's
it's a wonderful Theory it's a great
perspective to have and I don't want to
eliminate that I think it has incredible
amount of insight
however what behavioral economics
teaches us is that economics is not the
whole story it's not everything and when
you come to do policies or interventions
or to give recommendations for people to
how they want to live their life you
want to take as complete picture as you
want as you can so you want to take the
parts from economics that are accurate
and you want to fill as much as you can
above that from how people actually
behave
